meanings.definition: To hold closely in one's arms.
meanings.sent1: She was embracing her teddy bear tightly.
meanings.sent2: The mother was embracing her child with love.
meanings.sent3: The octopus was embracing all its tentacles around the coral reef.
meanings.sent4: The vines were embracing the old house, giving it a cozy look.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter was embracing the scared kitten to keep it safe from the fire.

meanings.sent1: He was embracing the new opportunity with excitement.
meanings.sent2: The students were embracing the idea of a field trip.
meanings.sent3: The dog was embracing the chance to go for a walk.
meanings.sent4: The town was embracing the concept of renewable energy.
meanings.sent5: She was embracing the challenge of learning a new language.

meanings.sent1: The package was embracing a surprise gift inside.
meanings.sent2: The book was embracing a world of adventure within its pages.
meanings.sent3: The picnic basket was embracing a delicious assortment of treats.
meanings.sent4: The garden was embracing a variety of colorful flowers.
meanings.sent5: The recipe was embracing a secret ingredient that made it special.
